full_summary:
# Tender Announcement
### Contract Title
Scanning of National Air Photo Library (NAPL) Air Photos
### Tender Reference Number
PW-22-01009859

### Overview

Natural Resources Canada (NRCan) and the National Air Photo Library (NAPL) are seeking qualified suppliers to electronically scan and reproduce original photographic material from the NAPL collection. This endeavor aims to preserve the original material and make further photogrammetry and photointerpretation possible from the reproductions. We invite suppliers to submit their offers for scanning services.

### Background

The NAPL collection includes aerial photographs on paper and original negative rolls. Suppliers will be required to scan and reproduce these materials while maintaining their original integrity. The tender process is divided into two Streams:

*   Stream A: Scanning black and white or color paper-based contact prints of aerial photographs at 800 DPI.
*   Stream B: Scanning original negative rolls at DPI exceeding 1500 (1501-2100 DPI). The successful tenderer(s) will be required to tender standing offers for scanning services under Stream A and/or Stream B.

### Requirements for the Standing Offer

Tenderers must:

*   Qualify a minimum of two (2) individuals in the scanning process for each stream.
*   Ensure the scan meets the specified technical requirements.
*   Provide a clear price and rate breakdown for the services rendered.
*   Demonstrate Compliance with all Health, Safety, and Environmental requirements outlined in the solicitation document.

### Terms of the Standing Offer

*   The Standing Offer shall remain valid for a period of one (1) year from the date of the Standing Offer Award.
*   Extensive scrutiny committees have confirmed that CSR files contain applicable civil legislation on health, safety and environment considerations.
*   Suppliers are invited to sign a contract at their earliest convenience.
